KfYIQ5as2ts4tTaQtGAXHg.text: yes!! I love this place. My favorite place to get sushi now. Decor is very intimate and inviting. Staff is always so friendly.

Zg-k2axWtc7spvpoxbJKHA.text: We ate here tonight (take-out) for the first time and thought the food was excellent!  The price is comparable to all the other Chinese restaurants in the area, but in our opinion the food is much better than any of the others. We have found our new go to place for Chinese take-out.

793_giPb9Nc9pKpwTYr1gQ.text: Went in to try them out for lunch today. Fast friendly service food was fresh got the gen chicken and happy shrimp and chicken noodle soup. The egg rolls are the best I've had in charlotte and that's saying a lot . Give them a try . Great food reasonable price

XaLEaG_K6-IJ8YHjcK1e4A.text: Fast service and pretty good food. Real hit for this place is the lunch specials - sit down food for almost less than fast food and service is almost as fast. Can get in and out in 20 minutes even when most of the restaurant is busy.  Not a place to come for sushi as much, but the Singapore Mei Fun and Curry Fried Rice are both great.

2ZlES2rYzU882qt2RBlzjw.text: What a pleasant surprise to find an above average Chinese restaurant in the Matthews area. I came for lunch with my seven year old son and we shared a lunch portion of tofu with mixed vegetables.  Here are my impressions:  PROS  *Beautiful decor *Attentive service *Spotlessly clean *Very good fried rice and tofu with mixed vegetables  CONS  *Weak tea (there's just no excuse...tea bags are cheap!) *Garden salad was just iceberg with a couple cucumbers and shredded carrots. Some romaine or mesclun would be so much healthier and tastier! Also the dressing came in a solo container with lid, tacky and not eco-friendly.  *No curry on the menu...I LOVE curry!!  Jo Jo China Bistro in Ballantyne was my favorite, and our family was devastated when it closed. Ming Fu could potentially be our new favorite with a few small changes.

ueqi1r5vZL2RpduhJEZZBw.text: OK minus the A Another Chinese-Japanese restaurant, a strange combination which seems popular in Charlotte for some reason, really don't know why. Three of us had lunch there a while back. First impression decor is dramatic, and service was prompt but that's the end of the good news.   As for the sushi the only fish they have is salmon and tuna or yellowtail, typical for Charlotte really. Honestly due to the lack of variety I've given up on Sushi restaurants these days. Instead I buy quality sushi grade yellowtail and Scottish salmon by the pound -the fish store up the street - we have everything we need, wasabi, soya, sesame etc to pig out on sashimi at home. :)  For lunch we ordered Gyoza and 3 items from the Chinese menu, one of them was a shrimp dish, the other two I can't remember because the cooking was generic and there was nothing memorable about it ...other than it was bland. Well at least it wasn't bad.  Nice place, average food. Matthews is a foodies hell.

FoLs5AkNlgnw2uZcbspf4A.text: Large portions, excellent atmosphere with dim lighting and privacy. Staff was amicable, professional and welcoming. The food was great though not the most delicious Chinese I've had. Consider the large portions with the pricing as I took almost a whole meal home after feeling full. Also A+ on the menu design.

Gs8t6d31RxssM7M7omRDwQ.text: Fantastic place!!... great atmosphere, diverse menu, and easily accessible in downtown Matthews. My wife and I highly recommend!!

_KIA2n01nFQcFil_v0hjEA.text: Granted we only had 2 rolls, a California (yes, we're American) and a crazy tuna, they were both fresh and delicious. The atmosphere was surprisingly tranquil and tasteful. This is NOT a corner Chinese food joint, in fact, nits on the more formal side. Great for date night, which was why I was there. Service was great and the menu extensive. Just about any roll you could want as well as all your standard Dishes, including kabobs for the kids. Drinks are inexpensive, and they have 4 or 5 varieties of Asian beer. No craft beer. I'll definitely go back.

rBiN2orpfnTsGUSllZyUrQ.text: I love this place. Their sushi tastes fresh and the service is excellent. I am so glad to have found it for my visits to north carolina.   I think its much better than New Zealand.

05t1r88wUf78WB-Fqzpzyg.text: I've been to the restaurant twice and on both occasions, the waitress Jenny always tried to rush us and kept asking me to leave her a tip and we weren't even finished with our food. The food is good, it's just bad customer service.

rt8DV9CAWsdZ5SI54KrsKw.text: Best chinese/sushi in the Matthews area. You will not be sorry. I have had both their chinese dishes and their sushi. Everything I've had has not disappointed.

LoUx8lq1BFsMdNypVNadKw.text: Very nice sushi, very nice atmosphere , the tuna tataki was awesome... But the service was awful, the girl who served was no good at all. Hope next time the service is better. But the place is awesome.

9ctBzEBzMPHHz0-gIdRI9w.text: This place keeps getting worse every time I go. Their most recent low was MICROWAVING our dinners. It was unmistakable, I had several pieces of rubbery pork that was cold on one side and scaldingly hot on the other.   The service is barely passable. The staff is nice and polite but just seem to have no interest in doing a good job. For example we asked our waitress for some plates for our kids. After telling us "ok" she went and played on her phone at a table in the back.  On a side note they only have 2 high chairs in a restaurant that seats probably 80. If we go when there are more than 10 other people dining we pretty much are guaranteed not to get a booster or high chair.  Which is a shame because the teriyaki kids meals with steamed broccoli are great!

5auLx3bjTP5osw2K-LdOoQ.text: Nice sushi, if unoriginal rolls. Fm really liked the dynamic and giant roll. Fresh and fast and lovely Kani salad. A great takeout sushi option for stallings and matthews.

qwPjdRx4MN6YJiDZP5hnzg.text: My favorite chinese place!! When i want maki rolls i only eat at mingfu! Price is great w/ friendly staff and good ambience!

Eiorcl3OykEG0qjItnWTcw.text: 6 in group and everyone was VERY PLEASED! Best Chinese food in Charlotte I have had in 14 years living here. Atmosphere is cozy, and the overall appearance is very clean. Food was very fresh and tasty and the service was excellent! First time I've been there but it won't be the last!!

6HgwI90_vrjIQ1_0Y-pCZA.text: Best Chinese in Matthews! We love this place now and come here all the time. They just have new management because the food quality is so much better!

gGEcUFyRufLQL9PKYfJg9w.text: Been going here for awhile but the service is going downhill and the sanitation of this restaurant is going way down. The plates literally had crud all over them. That's a good  indicator of the sanitation of the kitchen. I had to ask a hostess to take the order because the lady left us there forever. You could tell by her response it happens alot and she was embarrassed as if it was normal.  If your the owner and you are reading this: get your place together or I promise you won't be around for very long with the development moving out here.

oQRGT4_x8dK5VlguaoYUKQ.text: I was surprised by the aesthetic of this spot in Matthews. I had been to the Ming Fu in Waxhaw (Not sure if there is a connection?) and loved the sushi. Simple, easy enough, nothing short of familiar if you're a sushi savant, etc. Came for lunch with a friend recently and had a great experience.   High notes: Crunchy noodles before your meal. I'm a large proponent of fried noodles and Ming Fu does em right.   Utterly comfy seating. The booths are greatly comfortable and welcome your rear rather nicely.   Sashimi lunch platter is a killer deal. I think around $12 for 6 pieces of sashimi and a cali roll. Yellowtail, salmon, and tuna.   Only negative is that it's not closer to Uptown. A solid spot for lunch, and I'm sure for dinner as well, and I'm looking forward to coming back when in the area.   I'll miss you until I see you next time, Ming Fu.

vG2OybDG3jTWV11grfG-ng.text: Every time I order food from here, it is always hot, delicious, and served with a smile. The food and service is consistently excellent. Prices are low, but the atmosphere is that of a much higher class restaurant. I will continue coming here and would highly recommend.

dsLGWALyK8BtSXQzy-YETA.text: We used to go to this restaurant once a week for take-out. This was our go-to restaurant. We loved this place.  However,  they have either really gone down hill or changed managers. Our food has been old, cold, dry and tasteless and we live a half  mile away.  After several failed tries, hoping it was just a couple of mistakes, we realize it's not. So we are now hoping you are made aware that your take-out customers matter and that you adjust accordingly.

3o12ik2NClY6A4RN_-ANeg.text: We went for dinner. Service was friendly, but food was average at best, and took a really long time for each dish to come out, despite it being not that busy. Bottom line, we've had better sushi at plenty of places than what we had at Ming Fu, and better orange chicken and general chicken elsewhere too.

EHIHzbt4Wf-5Wt3L-WJelg.text: When you walk into this restaurant you're going to think it's going to be a lot more expensive than it is. But it's really not. The lunch portions are very very generous. And the dinner portions are generous as well. I am a huge fan of the sweet-and-sour chicken and shrimp fried rice. From what I've heard the sushi is good as well.

fHwYjscLfO69hFuZgTwuRA.text: Fresh sushi.  Good General Tso's chicken, though my broccoli was cold.  I wish they'd serve the rice on the plate w/ the food so I can easily slop up some of the GT's sauce with it.  Overall, not bad.

WjTJqOKRvahuHeHGUWFgyw.text: I found this restaurant by searching yelp. I'm so glad I did!  This Japanese restaurant has a nice atmosphere and very friendly staff.  I ordered spicy tuna roll, miso soup, and crab Rangoon.  Everything tasted wonderfully. I will definitely go back on my next visit to the city!

6zmv3DsORs-FUrc8D6bWzQ.text: Never even made it in the door. I am so sick and tired of places not trying to help their customers. I understand your meal comes with white/brown or fried rice. However if I ask to pay extra for HOUSE FRIED why not do it? Because you can push a $6 extra sale. That is crazy! Charge $3 for the upgrade and make the CUSTOMER happy. Boo! Poor customer service! In a small town too.

S6QiDnHuS6Xvirtat_SnAA.text: I ordered take out from here a few weeks ago. The best orange chicken I've ever had! Loved the sleek modern Asian interior. Had to pay extra for soup with carry out order though it was included with dine in. I thought that was strange. Eggrolls were great and so was the pork fried rice. I will definitely order carry out from here again.

photos.caption: Photo of MingFu Chinese & Sushi - Matthews, NC, United States. Sushi is amazing!

rmlMUdtMBiK1VoCUIiRV8A.text: Wow....probably the worst Chinese I have ever had.  Ordered a pupu platter...most,the food was reheated, the ribs, the beef strips, even the fried shrimp....smallest jumbo ship I ever saw...and cold...hard....the chicken wings, both of them were tiny...the crab Rangoon was good.  It was a joke...really....will never go back.

dpajS8zdfu-4n_lIomi4Lg.text: Finally! A place in Charlotte with boneless ribs! The dishes seem to be hit or miss when it comes to flavor. That being said, none of the dishes have been bad. They've all been at least good if not delicious. The sesame chicken has a nice fried crust but has a nice ratio of fried to chicken. The chicken and broccoli is tasty but could use a brown sauce or something to bump it up a notch. The broccoli is very fresh, even if you just get it as a side. The rice (white, brown, fried) is never stale or heavy.   We've done both dine in and take out and haven't noticed a big difference, which is awesome.  Every staffer I've interacted with, whether in person or over the phone, has been very pleasant.  The dining room isn't too large but can sit large parties fairly easily.   If you are coming from Trade, you don't have to get onto John to turn left into Ming Fu. Instead, turn in behind the Exxon. There is driving access that goes behind the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of MingFu Chinese & Sushi - Matthews, NC, United States. Finally!!!

Iqg8b9wgsyPaq16SlGmTAQ.text: This is my favorite pick-up and dine in Chinese food restaurant in the area.  The portion sizes are great.  The fried rice is made very well.  No strip mall yellowed rice here.   The appetizers are tasty.  The ambiance is nice and the staff are exceptional whenever I have to impress family from out of town this is my "go to" for a delicious lunch that pleases everyone's palate.

-h5Vt5S8v6VI0N7ZS8YdFQ.text: I have been coming to ming fu for a year now. I have only had the sushi but it is delicious!! The only con about the place is that they stopped making their own crunchy noodles - I miss their yummy appetizer. The ginger house salad has quality veggies as well.   Please bring back the crunchy noodles!!

VY1UppYMDW-5qVl31EG4hA.text: I stopped in to order some take out last weekend. I decided to order basil chicken with brown rice, a spring roll, and egg drop soup.  The food was ready quickly and when I got it home, found nice big portions, definitely enough for 2 people or 2 meals.  The food was a solid 3 stars, prices definitely comparable to other similar places.

xc0Um83a7lnhYXZWKlaKUA.text: Totally Gorgeous Interior!  Incredibly sweet Staff and Outstanding Service!  Food needs Work!!!  This place is completely remodeled and looks Great!!!  Modern Japanese looking design, simply and tastefully done!  Open yet with a feeling of privacy if you get one of the many booths and Booth-type seating on both sides... Impressive! A line of tables runs down the middle of the larger room!  Also two smaller Dining Rooms in the back!  From the Hostess to ALL Wait Staff (all Female) Sunday Night, everyone was Friendly and did a great job!  All the food comes out of the Kitchen each dish great Looking appearing to be designed with LOVE!  Pipping Hot and Fresh!  Flavor is where the yelp stars fall!  Each of the dishes I got was, just  ok, close to, almost three stars or good, not any better than good!

tfRKlP1SA6K8i8e7yc6M4A.text: My mother and I went to dinner at Ming Fu last night. We ordered hot tea, soups, sushi, and a chicken and shrimp with both broccoli in brown sauce dish (we omitted the beef).   The service was nice and quick. The food tasted fine.   We got food poisoning. We were up all night off and on and can't leave the house now.   Please use caution in eating here. I ate here once before and it was fine too but fine isn't a good enough reason to risk food poisoning. I don't think I can ever go back. Felt compelled to share.

8FZsmazwUNY_8u5Uf3iaYQ.text: Been here twice now.  First time got a noodle bowl which was very good and a nice value (probably what they do best honestly)  The crab rangoon was a great appetizer and way better than any buffet version I've had.    The second visit however, I wanted to try something different so I got the orange beef... which was disgusting.  The beef was overcooked and not tender.  The sauce was overly syrupy and way too sweet with NO taste of orange apart from the hard little candied orange peel curlies swimming in the sauce at the bottom of the plate.  There were four cold broccoli florets included but they had not been tossed with the stir fry....thus were cold and tasteless.  I'm no chef and I'm not from China but I can tell you they missed the boat on this one (no pun intended).  I plan on continuing to go here, I will try the sushi next time.

fQD43D_uG_n5efzLwqyU7g.text: Stopped in for the first time tonight and was surprised by the cool decor and happy to be seated at a secluded table in the back.  I was a little disappointed by the lack of innovation in the vegetarian selections, but ordered sauteed broccoli with tofu and a veggie roll. The veggie roll was super greasy and instead of sauteed broccoli with tofu, I received mixed vegetables with tofu. However, the tofu was flavorful and the veggies well prepared.   We'll stop in again, and I'll take extra care in ordering to avoid any future mix-ups.

0hIrxhRUVvL5pR_X_9GtZw.text: We eat here often and the service is friendly and quick. The food is consistently great quality. And in my opinion the best sushi in the Matthews area

-HRMCnfvdQZYjJ5yI5kroQ.text: A very nice, affordable sit down Asian restaurant.  The food is very good, the staff friendly,  and the atmosphere is relaxed. I recommend the basil chicken,  while my wife really enjoys the steak and lobster sizzling platter. If you're tired of eating at those ratty tables they throw up front in most take out joints, then MingFu is what the doctor ordered.  It's classic Asian cuisine done in a classy and delicious way.

gQIBIJSj3fMDkcDPnP1UlA.text: Been a few times before and always loved the food.  The lunch was great as always.  However, tried a sushi app to test the waters and got exactly what I expected.  Standard sushi for a Chinese place. Mealy frozen fish and flavorless sushi rice. If you like "sushi" with mayo and crunchies and cream cheese you'll do fine.  Otherwise, stick with the Chinese fare.

h7bOWeS0A6Qh37OgchN7Sg.text: Fast service and very good food.  I had fried rice with shrimp and Tiger roll. Very god portion of shrimp and food the sushi was very fresh.

Lk3C4k2qF3yvaeCJC7GChQ.text: We have been looking for a place closer to home for great Sushi and Chinese. We found it!! The sushi was awesome. They offered the regulars California Roll, Tuna Roll,etc. but also some awesome specialty rolls. We had the Red Dragon Roll and found it so good we ordered another! Fast service, delightful wait staff and great prices made this our new favorite Asian!

dHlIpIh5iqAbDoWK0uXfmw.text: Went to this place for the first time on Sunday night. The food was very good. High-quality chicken, beef, and the shrimp fried rice was borderline excellent. There were six of us and every meal was good. The service was a little slow - the waitress disappeared for more than 20 minutes while we were in the middle of eating - but this place is a solid 4 stars. It is quite comparable to P.F. Chang's.

KirBcj1-wXeo8u5d1ZD_lg.text: Service - good, but could improve knowledge and selling skills during ordering; Food - some are tasty, some are bland; Decor - nice; Management - non existent.  I was looking forward to trying Ming Fu in Matthews (they also have a location in Waxhaw, so having 2 restaurants must mean they are doing something right).  Immediately walking in you are greeted with smiles.  But it seems that patrons usually walk past the hostess desk and head for the area where there is a cashier.  It was the first area that you see walking in, but another woman had to walk over to the hostess desk to grab the menus.  Seems a little inefficient or confusing.  That's when I noticed the sushi bar.  The sushi bar looked inviting and I probably would have enjoyed sitting there for a meal but we had our 7 year old with us.  Next time, if it is just me and my husband we will probably sit at the sushi bar.  The decor is really nice (not too much, not too little). My husband did point out that the paper lamps looked as if someone smeared poo on them.  I thought he was crazy but when I looked up I could not agree more.  My daughter and I were grossed out but it was a good laugh.  Trying to forget the poo smeared paper lamps, I went back to the study the menu.  I asked the waitress for suggestions on a few things to try but both times she said she hadn't tried them yet (I asked for a suggestion between bbq ribs vs. boneless ribs; and to offer suggestions on spicy sushi - she has only tried one out of the entire menu, and the one she tried was not spicy).    We ended up ordering the following:  -egg rolls - very good, everything an egg roll should be -bbq ribs - a little dry, nothing to write home about. the marinade and sauce does not taste homemade.  It is very much like the packaged dry rub you can find at Asian groceries -wonton soup - the dumplings are nice and plump. The broth was salty but otherwise tasteless.  It could use flavor and maybe some more green onions. -pork fried rice - decent and average.  It was not bad but not special. -volcano roll - we ordered this because it sounded similar to the volcano roll we order at one of our favorite sushi restaurants back home (Chicago).  This roll was terrible and tasteless at Ming Fu. -crunch roll - this roll was very similar tasting to the volcano roll so it was also terrible and tasteless. -roll w/soft shell crab but I can't remember the name - tasteless, just ok. -sesame beef with brown rice (I ordered this to go since I did not enjoy the sushi and did not eat very much while I was seated and it was the first item on the Chefs Specialty list. I had a few bites of this when I got home) - it was pretty good and kept my hopes up that I might actually enjoy the entrees more than the sushi.  Overall, the service food was okay.  I want to come back in a few weeks to see if the food improves.  I will definitely be back a couple more times to give the specialty sushi and a few other entrees a try.  I want to give this place 4 stars, but I am just not a fan.  Seeing how the food tasted, I don't think it is deserving of 4 stars.  A few things about the staff - if I was the owner I would make sure that my staff could offer suggestions instead of say "I haven't tried anything".  Here is a suggestion - have your staff try the food before you have them on the floor.  How can you expect your staff to "sell" your food, if they don't believe in it and if they haven't tried it?  It's a great way to up-sell and make sure patrons feel confident about their orders.  Also, I did not see management on the floor at all.  Not one person came to ask us how the food or service was.  I would think that at a new restaurant, management would want to hear from customers and try to get repeat business.  Sushi - if you can't "create" specialty maki, don't do it.  I go out for maki because I don't make it at home.  I can easily get fresh fish from the market and make sushi - nigiri, but I enjoy going out for specialty rolls just to see and taste what others create.  If you don't have flavor or presentation, then it's not worth it to me to pay what you charge for a little piece of fish (or worse - imitation crab) from your menu.

rEHmqjN7jH71xja6oKqNMA.text: Not impressed. The food was average at best. My wife and I were disappointed especially after having chosen this place based on the positive reviews.

TlXvB6HttmNCVIPDWKGeLQ.text: Place is great as well as food.  Our server Audrey knew the menu and is a great source of information!  Price is reasonable and good size serving.  Definitely a place to come back too!  :-)

Hh77jlqNsWZBhlAbbe2Lww.text: This was the second time we've Ming Fu, this time for some birthday celebrations. The atmosphere continues to be energetic and upscale. Comfortable seats, good prices, great food. How can you go wrong? We ordered the chicken in lettuce and fried shrimp as appetizers. I loved the sauce on lettuce wrap! Comes as four and the three of us fought for the last one! We had the seafood fried rice, Hunan chicken, and the Dragon Phoenix (my favorite on this visit). Great combinations especially as we are family style eaters! We will definitely be coming again! And a surprise dessert at the end to help celebrate the birthdays!

9Bwh1azOx9o55ks0RSpNJw.text: My family took me to Ming Fu for Mother's Day and I must say the food and the service was wonderful!  We had the teriyaki skewers as an appetizer and our main course was duck, chicken and broccoli and sesame chicken. Our waitress Marissa was warm and friendly and very efficient! She was very attentive and made our experience at Ming Fu exceptional! We will definitely be back!

WP3kUXII4536MHX6ijHUSg.text: Service was fast and efficient. Rolls were excellent. Hot & sour was great but wonton soup had a very doughy wonton. Entrees were very good and huge - took half home. Fried rice was dry and bland

P6d2sjZT-FQXmnurMEH1-w.text: We are fairly new to the Charlotte area, and this is the third Chinese place we have tried in Matthews (Best Wok and can't remember the name of the other one by Once Upon a Child).  So far, Ming Fu is our favorite. We have dined in once and order take out for lunch once.  Our dine in experience was excellent. Great service, fresh and tasty food. The decor is nice  and modern compared to most other Chinese restaurants in Matthews. My wife and son ordered sushi while my daughter and I split an order of pork lo-mein and orange beef, and pork dumplings for an appetizer. All of our food was pretty good, except the orange beef was a bit on the bland side. My wife said that Ming Fu has restored her taste for sushi. She said the last time she had sushi this good was when we lived in Nashville and she would go to Ken's.  Our take out experience was excellent as well. Sweet and sour pork was very good. The batter was crunchy and not thick, and the pork inside was fairly tender and not chewy like so many other Chinese take out joints. My wife had the cashew chicken and said it was very good, and we split some more lo-mein. The lunch portions are a decent size too and the cost is right on.  For any one who is nervous about trying a new place, I suggest try the take out first (be sure to eat it asap), and then if you are happy, dine in. The atmosphere is great inside and the servers are extra nice!

AT4iYRNSSHEJZW-0xTWZRA.text: Having eaten sushi before this place was something else to consider.  What I experienced though was an excruciating headache and nausea for 24+ hour following the meal (sushi tuna and salmon plus spring roll).  Not returning.

n7Qe8wJNTGmZDCtBa1Zf4Q.text: My family and I have been to this place twice.  First time like most, I was impressed with their decor and food but was totally turned off when I had to take my little one to the restroom.  It had no paper towels or dryer and the toilets did not flush.  It was gross and made me wonder how the employees washed their hands.    Few weeks later I did go back to find, still no paper towels and gross bathroom.  I did complain about the state of the bathroom to our waitress but I have not returned to see if they have changed and I don't think I could.  I can't understand why the bathroom was so dirty when it's clear that they spent money decorating the place so nicely.

frjAoXeHJwx8k52bNbuIXQ.text: I did enjoy the food I have ordered for pick up several times, my critique addresses the horrendous service I received while dining in.  On a Monday night where the guest were minimal, a friend and I arrived at the planned time of 5:45 p..m.  We were immediately seated at a table for four next to a table for eight which had been recently utilized per evidence of the remaining dirty serve ware and place settings that indicated a feast had been recently enjoyed.  The hostess who seated us seemed to be at a loss for a smile or welcoming greeting.  We viewed the menu and when our server arrived ten minutes later, we placed our order.  Neither of the two staff members seemed to notice the pile of dirty dishes glaring at their current guest.  Our orders began arriving ten minutes later, and considering we were having the Triple Delight soup and  sharing a Pu Pu Platter, we were pleased with that part of our service.  While our server was adequate, she seemed to lack any type of personalty and just  "did her job" which added nothing to the experience, but felt awkwardly disturbing.   Once our complete orders had been received I wondered why each time something had been brought to our table, some of the dirty dishes from the adjacent table could not have been removed.  I found the experience disgusting and extremely distracting from the ambiance the restaurant seemed to be going for with the very nice decor.  As my dining companion was asked if she were finished and indicated that she was, her dishes were removed from in front of her along with sauces I was using to compliment the items on the Pu Pu Platter, I indicated that I was not finished and the waitress actually attempted to remove the condiment dish from my companion's dirty soup bowl and place it back on the table.  Once I indicated that her actions were unacceptable the waitress said she would return with "another" bowl.  When she returned with the "new" condiment she readily removed the remaining items I planned to eat from the platter.  Okay then, I guess I'm done.  The adjacent table was still filthy when we left and when I mentioned that I was unacceptable to this waitress, she indicated that it was not "her" table.  I replied, "we were" to which she offered a sheepish "I'm sorry".  So if that's what passes for adequate or good service, I'm good, THANKS!

lMBfvH34qqa1N61RR4hMVA.text: Great service, food was served very quickly. Sushi was quite good, orange beef pieces were a bit large but nicely flavored. We will return.

UhdafbB0KLLdYcnCDlucJg.text: Ming Fu had a nice decor inside and was very clean. The lunch combo I ordered was tasty but the potion was very small. Overall, I would give an average rating.

kztdeErHu87oJ-ze-n_l3A.text: Just left and we loved the food. Recently relocated here from Massachusetts and have searched for Chinese food close to what we had back home. Our search is over!! The food here was fabulous!! Tasted better AND cost less! Our server was friendly and delivered food quickly. We have a new favorite now!

nXdxubZvU0hABe1NEH4s6g.text: Polite & quick service - visited on a wednesday evening - fresh food, not greasy as some chinese places can be - we will definitely go again

rx-QYtv6qTz-0K7fc0E41Q.text: The sushi was just OK. The server recommended I try one of their giant sushi rolls b/c it had more seafood inside. The roll was just ok and very difficuly to eat. ZPvBlJuR2sxAgWCHWGfX9A.text: I love this place! We went for the second time last night and it was just as good as the first! We've tried their Sushi, Lettuce Wraps, Mongolian Beef, Hunan Chicken, Wonton Soup. FTW!  Everything we've tried has been simply delish! The food comes out quickly, ingredients are fresh and tasty. 2Z0CgN8WMHhaSwWvAbvmKg.text: My partner was in the mood for Chinese food last night, so I was a little skeptical as I considered the options:  fast food Chinese takeout?  No.  A Chinese buffet?  No.  Chain restaurant PF Chang's?  No.  An 1980s-decorated Chinese sit-down restaurant?  Definitely, no.   That's when he remembered seeing a new place being built in Matthews.  We drove by Ming Fu to see if it was open yet.  We had been at this establishment before just a couple of years ago when it was a burger place.  It was very nicely decorated inside before, but walking into Ming Fu now, you wouldn't even recognize it from before.  They've totally redone the inside and gave it a very modern, calming Zen-like feel.  It was beautifully, yet simply, decorated, and I was already immediately impressed upon walking in the doorway.    The menu options were very diverse without being overwhelming like at some Chinese restaurants.  There were decent typical Chinese $10ish meals or, if you wanted to get something a little more high-end, there were $15ish meals.  We opted for the first, along with a couple of cups of soup.    Our server brought out complimentary fried Chinese noodles with a spicy mustard and sweet and sour dipping sauce, and all of these were tasty.  The hot and sour soup was good, but not as flavorful, peppery, or spicy as some I've had.  The Sa Cha Chicken entree (broccoli, water chestnuts, snap peas, brown sauce) was very good, too, with a "just right"-sized portion served on modern dinnerware.  Although denoted as spicy, it too wasn't anywhere what I'd call spicy.  I like some heat!  Some sriracha or hot chile sauce/paste on the table would have been a much welcome addition.  I had to resort to adding heat by using the Chinese mustard.    The service was great and friendly, and we're definitely going back.  The atmosphere alone is awesome, and then you get the bonus of a very reasonably priced, good Chinese meal.

gAjmBOj9PJ3MezdHYouLzA.text: This is a truly a great hidden treasure. I wasn't familiar with Ming Fu until a friend recommended it. I am so glad that he did. The first time we ate here I must confess that our meal was so great that when we got home I almost asked my wife if we could go back and eat again. Not that I was hungry (the portions are huge) but that the flavors were that great. Every time I eat here I can't wait for the next time. The Sushi at Ming Fu is excellent; well prepared, nicely presented and full of fresh flavor. As good as the sushi is the full meals are even better. Everything is presented in a very artistic manner as Asian food should be. I love any of the shrimp dishes. They use HUGE shrimp and lots of them. Each of the sauces I have tried with shrimp has been wonderful. My wife likes chicken and is particular about the vegetable mix it is served with. Our server never seems nonplussed when we ask for certain deletions or substitutions. It is always served just as she asked for.  The atmosphere here is very conducive to a nice evening out. The decor is understated and adds a nice touch to the ambiance. The staff is very attentive. We are always treated warmly and made to feel very welcome. We hope to enjoy many more meals here in the future.

QLqWCGZNH9F-8IagqhzrOw.text: As with most families, we were on our way to run other errands around 6:00 pm on a Friday (silly I know) low and behold we were hungry (borderline starving).  Now here comes the part where we are driving and we have no idea where to go out to eat.  We do however know where we don't know where to eat.  We knew we wanted Chinese and being this is Indian Trail/Matthews area there isn't much between here and there (did I mention we were on our way to Costco?)  We did a search for Chinese and Ming Fu came up.  We've always passed Ming Fu and it looks pretty good from the outside. That's our first indication on trying something, does it look clean on the outside.  Well it was Friday Night crazy busy!  The people inside were super nice though.  They tried to be as quick as possible to get us seated.  It might have been because my 11 year old is a loud talker and they wanted to muffle his voice with food...just a thought.  The only critique I have is with the smell. It smelled like my mother-in-laws house, but that could be just me.  I had the shrimp chow mein, it was a nice big serving with my choice of rice.  Two  of the shrimp hadn't been deveined which is a gross thing for me (shrimp poo you know), but otherwise delish.  They serve the wanton crackers as a pre-meal treat.  We asked for another bowl which our server gratefully gave us, but no more than 2 servings (I'm kidding, she took our bowl after the second helping, so I'm not kidding).  For a family of 4 with drinks and appetizers it came to around an average of $13.00 a person.  Not too bad for dinner.  We'll be back I'm sure.

UxslRliCb1qyZMHEuEAtug.text: Living so close to Ming Fu, this is our go to Chinese restaurant. As the saying goes,  "If it ain't broke,  dont fix it". I always get the sweet and sour chicken, and add beef to my fried rice. My wife typically get the shrimp or chicken and brocolli and crab rangoon and it's always delicious. The only bad dishes we ever get from there is the Lo Mein. I would admit,  although I love this place for the food, price, and convenience (8 minutes from my front door) the Lo Mein has caused me to venture back to my old Chinese spot 15-20 mins away. I always come back though. I sometimes order sesame chicken with light sesame seeds and they have no problem fixing my order to my specifications. The owners are great,  when I call and give my name they usually recognize my voice and its always a pleasant conversation with a few laughs and jokes over the phone giving me more confidence in my order being correct. I never have to wait longer than the 15 mins promised and that's always a plus for me. I would recommend Ming Fu and although I have ventured off, I always return.

8FnAcU3mW_SqwwaXbAYNHQ.text: We had great hopes for this place when it opened. Take out was good, fast and cheap, eat in was slow, rude and felt as If we were intruding. Over the past few months the food quality has slipped to a new low, but luckily for us the last three times we tried to order take out they put us on hold till we nearly starved to death and ate leftovers.

UesvZprdoswxIbbSELU5Pg.text: Reviewing ONLY the sushi ... this place makes me wonder if "Ming Fu" translates to "Mediocre Food."    It was hardly the worst sushi I've ever had ... but there is no reason to come here for it, either.  The seaweed wrap on one of the three rolls I had was so chewy it was difficult to get through.  Put it this way: I had to intentionally focus on grinding my teeth through that seaweed.  I didn't have time to raise my hand about it and send it back for a new one, as I was on a defined timeline that night.  I would ordinarily give the chef a second shot at making it right ... but then again, should I have to?  The fish was fresh enough (not fishy ... thankfully, because it was a Saturday night, not a Sunday) ... but it was quite bland.  I love spicy tuna in general, but these rolls barely told my tongue that they were there.  Nice ambiance, and I have a number of friends who enjoy their more traditional Chinese dishes.  I can't speak to that ... just was disappointed to have a weak experience here and can't see much reason to give it another shot.

U7qhNfROJoMVuch62nBU8g.text: Really great restaurant and atmosphere for working lunches. We enjoy bringing clients here! The food and service is always great! We definitely recommend this place!

HptN9oKYRGmJAJ_Qpcop0g.text: Yum!! Ming Fu has officially been added to my family's rotation of restaurants (and there are literally like 3 restaurants on that rotation, we never go out...).  Anyways, the food is really good and fresh tasting, the service is always pleasant and it's nice to sit outside in the summer.  The only thing I'm not a fan of are the weird wooden plates the sushi comes on, it's hard to eat off of.    Anyone who has been around Matthews is sure to share my excitement that a restaurant is finally sticking around in that building after so many failed ones.  Give Ming Fu a try, it won't disappoint!

abH8InqmUBRYpuXD-38R2A.text: I was definitely impressed about the look of the place- very nice decorations and location.  However, while eating the waitresses kept lowering the curtains until it was nearly pitch black.  The prices were certainly affordable as it came with crunchy things, salad (ginger dressing was good) and the meal.  Now i've had the sesame chicken before and it was very good but this time i got the fantasy chicken. DO NOT GET THE FANTASY CHICKEN under any circumstances- the "special mayo sauce" literally tastes like helmans mayo dished out onto the chicken.  I couldnt even eat it, but I was thankful the waitress brought me some new chicken with sweet and sour sauce instead.  Overall this place was just OK.

6653dBHhKbMwTlpq8EZcOg.text: We have been here several times and have had no complaints.  The soups are great, as are the potstickers.  We come mainly for sushi, which is always fresh.  We've tried most of the rolls and there aren't any we don't like. Yay!  The waitstaff is hit or miss, but typically pretty good.  The restaurant is really pretty inside and allows plenty of space so you don't feel crowded in.  They also have outdoor seating which is rare for a sushi spot.  Plenty of parking and in a nice location near downtown Matthews.  We look forward to visiting again!

T08-K35QsW5Rnho5-0424w.text: This is our go to place for sushi. It has always been very good. Their Chinese options are ok to good, depending in what you get. I will say that the lo mein is not good at all-it has been soggy and gross every time we've ordered it.

EbqJyoUP9A2S3_qow4OjzA.text: Ming Fu had been recommended to us so we went for dinner.  It was an awesome experience.  The food was delicious and the service was excellent.  My husband had sushi then we shared Ming Fu Special, Seafood Lo Mein and Pineapple Fried Rice.  Everything was very fresh and delicious.  My favorite thing was nothing was loaded with salty soy sauce.  It was nicely seasoned and the seafood was perfectly cooked.  We have a new favorite restaurant!

Eyhj88nPP55QLVxHCZgHkQ.text: My wife & I Have past by this place a few times and finally decided to give it a try. I am glad we did! The restaurant is very clean and has a nice ambience, The sanitation score was 97.5. The staff is very friendly and courteous. We started with some sushi and it was very good, fresh and plated beautifully. We also ordered the pork fried rice, chicken chow mein and the four happiness, ( I was very hungry ) and everything was great. So do yourself a favor and give it a try!

FeQhtxlXkjpylA6E9fdqUw.text: Everything a sushi place should have. It's delicious! We've been looking for a new "go to" sushi bar and we found it! The whole menu is very reasonably priced as well. In general MingFu is a great place to go when craving sushi.

cBtX84sBq64U_ybdDwwdQg.text: If zero stars was possible, that's what I would have rated them, mostly for their service and the attitude of their "hostess". We came in and asked for a table for 10 people. The hostess was very rude and said no, but we could be seated at 2 separate tables. Fine. After being seated, we asked the waitress if it was possible to have our order within 40 minutes, as we had to be somewhere at a certain time. No problem she said. Our table had 4 people. 2 of the people received their orders right away. The other 2 people waited. And waited. And waited. No food. The other half of our party ate, akwardly, as we insisted they eat... we were sure our food would be arriving shortly. After 40 minutes and the other 2 dishes hadn't arrived (a roll and a sashimi plate, which our other party of 6 had already received),  we approached the hostess (Cam, Kam, sp?) about having the food removed from our bill, as we had to leave and the food still hadn't arrived. In the bitchiest manner posssible, she said she knew there was no way they were going to be able to do our food and that they shouldn't have sat us. Well.. that would have been nice to know before we sat down. Rude, arrogant, unaccomodating, just a few words to describe their very unpleasant and unprofessional  hostess.

zSLHmZCfcxkKvjpXXgpwzA.text: Very good place for lunch and diner. All their dishes are very tasty and their sushi is very good. Highly recommended

ma-LiFquXXDWnSwIg_2uMg.text: I've never eaten in the restaurant but order takeout once every couple weeks. Their internet menu is a little hard to navigate but by now we pretty much know what we want.  The food is excellent for the price, especially the general chicken and sesame chicken, and it's always ready when we show up.  The ladies up front are very friendly.

l77hsldSniiaIIeUl6ORmw.text: I highly recommend the sushi here. The Chinese is great, too! This is a great place for date night or gathering with friends and family.

aQRPVoEluCSeqPGWoue8mw.text: Great service.  Lunch was a value for the money and very tasty.  Nice ambience with modern decor.  Went at 1 pm and the parking lot was full!

qGYywRx-ixYs95mWeDUrfQ.text: This is a great find in suburban Charlotte. The ambiance was great. Service was good, and our waiter was very pleasant. This seems to be a good date or family venue.  As far as food, I had the salmon roll and general chicken. I'm not huge on sushi, but it was great here! The general chicken was also great. I highly recommend if you like Chinese or sushi.

U0lF17hu_xYcmwhAaZZAeQ.text: Place was a great find here in Matthews. The service was great and the staff was friendly. I had the crunch roll and it was delicious!  The sesame chicken was great! Beware of the house mustard! It is a spicy surprise!

GFU2NdfFhorlhKrjDj1rFw.text: This is hands down the best Chinese in the Charlotte area. Fresh ingredients, great atmosphere and excellent menu selection.

gaG_02yqjKA45tI2ahevEQ.text: Not a fan of two in one restaurants, e.g. a Chinese/Japanese Restaurant.  Just my opinion but two completely different types of food, not sure why they're always lumped together.  We still checked it out because we were in the area and found it had good reviews.  A bit disappointing.  Visually a great place, very clean and great decor.  The appetizers were great, we had egg drop soup along with some boneless ribs.  Each tasted great so we thought our entrees would be even better.  We were mistaken.  Sweet and Sour Pork did not taste fresh, was incredibly hard and so was my fried rice.  My wife's fried rice was just as hard and her pepper steak was extremely bland.  Service was pleasant and fast however.  Good lunch specials as well.  Just wish the food was better.

bJhxBh_IkTuCiqV4daJWJA.text: Had the volcano roll for lunch - reasonably priced.  However, for something that was supposed to be spicy, there was no kick to it at all.  Even the wasabi was bland!  Atmosphere was great & the food that my friends ordered all looked quite good.  I don't know know that I'll make a special trip back since it was a group luncheon and it was a drive for me.  I've had better sushi closer to home.  Not great, but not bad.

Uz2T2VuVo6C0T2Q52UO5dQ.text: Decent Americanized Chinese and pretty good Sushi.  So it's hard to find good Chinese in the Charlotte area and I was pleasantly surprised by the food I got. I had ordered General Tao's Chicken. It was very crispy with large pieces of chicken and the sauce was great and got a pretty decent portion. I did not want a salad so I ordered the soup and got Wonton soup. Others at my table got salad and its just ice burg lettuce with your choice of dressing (not very Chinese but I was told it was good). Everyone ordered some sort of Chinese dish and 2 in our party ordered Sushi.  The food was good but for the price I would have expected better as far as the sushi and soup\salads go.   Pros: 1. Our service was great and we had a very attentive server despite it being very busy on a Friday night.  2. it was very clean and up to date as far as the interior goes. 3. Food was good and hot. 4. I'm a sucker for those wonton chips. 5. I love spicy Chinese mustard and boy do they have it!  Cons: 1. They only serve beer and wine. 2. Little on the pricey side. 3. I love traditional fried wontons, which they do not serve.  Along with not serving other traditional Chinese appetizers. (This is not to be confused with crab rangoon)  4. Small inside dining area, This place fills up quick after 6pm during the winter time, it can get very crowded.

X8Ihv9b6vmY0fVDX1RV8bw.text: My friend and I went for lunch. Their lunch specials are 7 days a week, which is awesome. I got Singapore Mei Fun. Good, solid, what one expects of this dish. Avoid the egg drop soup - it has corn in it! Never in my life! It was just egg and corn, no tofu or anything. My friend got some sushi, which was standard fare, nothing special. Her side salad was quite big and looked fresh. Service was very fast and our server was sweet and attentive. Prices were fair as were the portions. Nice ambiance.

GfRlnRNgX92rX8w-9NRdgg.text: Every time I come here, the food gets worse.  I'm 100 percent sure our food has been microwaved.  I've gave this place enough chances to cook us a decent meal, never again.    Microwaved food, they should be ashamed.

kh0pqU74pm0NYa6-pP-EPw.text: Sushi bar is not in operation half the time.  Can't get a drink while waiting to get seated.  Poorly run.

photos.caption: Photo of MingFu Chinese & Sushi - Matthews, NC, United States

KHhlTsUdl0ockOky4dSwPQ.text: FINE, YOU WIN Ming Fu. Take my money. It's not like I have a weakness for small cozy places that serve Asian cuisine to perfection or anything. I don't know what kind of ninjas you have snooping around, finding out what my exact likes are and then creating a restaurant to meet those exact secret desires, but it's not fair that you play on all my weaknesses at once.   How Ming Fu will destroy me financially:  - Has great sushi my wife likes - Has a great selection of vegetarian options I like - Tastes better than PF Changs, without the wait - Tastes more authentic than Pei Wei, with more style - Tasty spring rolls - Good selection of interesting appetizers - Really nice servers and hostesses  - A lively but comfortable atmosphere when it gets hoppin - Nice floors - no really, I love their floors, whoever did their decorating did a great job and picked out some nice flooring.   As a person addicted to Asian fare, I like to snobbishly approach a new restaurant like Ming Fu, who covers a variety of Asian cuisine. I found everything so far to be above average to excellent. Looking forward to summer when the front courtyard opens up.

aok5pqSvtWCrOnI580wGjQ.text: Oh, boy, do I like Ming Fu.  My wife and I really enjoy good Chinese food, and her favorite place to go was always Ming Fu in Waxhaw (Cureton Shopping Center). After a few times there, I was hooked. Now, we live in Matthews, so Ming Fu wasn't our go-to spot, unless we were in the area.  Until Ming Fu came to Matthews.   We found out that it's the same ownership and menu as the Waxhaw location, so we were excited. And justifiably so.  The food is always delicious, and presented beautifully. The chef makes little decorative pieces with the food, such as a bird made from an orange slice on an appetizer, a rose made from a radish for the dinner plates, etc.  Chicken and beef are tender, and seasoned well. The sauces are all done beautifully, and can be adjusted to your needs (like it spicier? just ask). The sushi is great, it's very fresh and tasty. The rice is sticky like it should be, and the fish is wonderful. The soups are good, as are the appetizers.  The service is a little lack-luster at times, but they are always attentive to our needs and genuine.  The decor is very modern, and has an "asian fusion" feel to it - lots of dark colors and modern patterns mixed with very classical feeling oriental elements. It's nice to look at, for sure.  Parking can be limited because of the location, but we've not had much of a problem finding a spot.  I always leave satisfied and very happy with the food.

photos.caption: Photo of MingFu Chinese & Sushi - Matthews, NC, United States. Dragon &amp; Phoenix combination platter - General Chen&#39;s Chicken and giant shrimp, with a decorative radish rose on the side.

hB4664LJBWc1PMGIEgbfFA.text: Where do I start? Today was a trying day for me and my family. So after passing this restaurant a couple times today was the day we we're going to try it. We walked in and the restaurant was clean looking but the rating was a 93 with that aside we decided to try. After being seated and looking over the menu I order the lettuce wraps the chicken one. My daughter order shrimp tempura roll and a salad. The salad was horrible and tasteless the Ginger dressing didn't even help it. It to was tasteless how do you make Ginger dress tasteless. The food came out quicky making me feel it wasn't fresh and the taste confirm our suspicious. The this food was God awful. Asia food has natural flavor without sauce but this food taste like straight cardboard. I couldn't find the flavors nowhere and my daughters food omgoodness is all I have to say. I asked how was cooking this stuff I really wanted to offer a suggest "add more flavor"!

57vn68YbFt3hWoeW2Cr1Gg.text: Our favorite place to get sushi! The staff is very friendly and quick to seat us. We frequently go there when we are feeling in the mood for Asian cuisine.

lUhFukJhWQWyzoFNK5InrQ.text: I'm somewhat new to the Matthews area and have been trying all the restaurants in town when I get the opportunity. I've tried several of the different sushi/Chinese selections and this is by far a chopstick above the rest! Friendly service, accurate time frame for food delivery and wonderful quality of food makes myself rate this establishment 5 stars. I HIGHLY recommend a visit if you haven't already.

LMYP_aMbZ-MSE5lBD9j-DQ.text: SUMMARY: 2nd time I've been here and had terrible service. Waited 1 hour 40 minutes during lunch and only received my soda. Had to ask the waitress about my soup, and again about my sushi, both of which were "overlooked."   .....  Today marks the second time I've eaten at this restaurant and have had an awful experience. It's literally the worst service I've ever had at any restaurant. I joined a group of several other coworkers for lunch at noon. The restaurant was reasonably busy, but nothing too hectic or full for a lunch hour.   I ordered a coke zero, hot and sour soup, and a Rock N Roll. My coke zero arrived on time, though it was in a 20 oz bottle while the others had fountain drinks. After about 30 minutes, everyone received their soup and salad, except mine, which the waitress seemed unaware that I ordered anything or that anything was missing. She brought out my soup about ten minutes later, but informed me they were out of soup spoons, but that I could just use the small spoon included in my silverware.   After 1 hour, the entrees arrived. The majority of us ordered sushi. The waitress said something happened with their computer, and asked if it was okay if all of the sushi was on one platter instead of separated for each order. This is strange to eat off of a platter in the middle of a large table, so we asked if they could split it up by roll type, unsure of why a computer is necessary to do so. The waitress took the food away and came back with it sorted about 10 minutes later. We had to ask for the sauce bowls, soy sauce, ginger, etc. These items are normally brought out with the silverware.   However, my sushi was missing, and I was told it "overlooked". My coworkers finished their meals and asked for their checks while I continued to wait for my food. After about 30 minutes since everyone received their food (we had now been at the restaurant for 1 hour and 40 minutes), they brought our checks and handed me my sushi in a to-go box. The waitress asked if we needed anything else, and we asked to speak to a manager.  The manager came over to our table, apologized, and said that today had been "kind of overwhelming." At this point, there were only 4 or 5 other tables, and the rest of the restaurant was empty. I expressed my concern that I waited 1 hour and 40 minutes and had been unable to eat with my coworkers, and asked if they could wave the cost of my meal. They did so, but did nothing to accommodate my other coworkers.   The food is great at Ming Fu. The prices are fair. The servings are normal. However, none of it is so outstanding that I would be willing to sit through that terrible service again. The service was awful the first time I went (another lunch visit on a slow day), but I figured I would give them a second chance. Stuff happens, and it's not fair to write a long, scathing review because of a bad day. However, my second visit was even worse than the first, and I will not be returning again.  I won't name drop competition (since it will look like I work for the competitor, which I don't), but there are plenty of other Japanese restaurants within a 5 minute radius. I encourage you to go there instead.

DT-xHCHDVeTfRfT6VypzEg.text: The building that is now the home of Ming Fu has been 4 different restaurants since I have been on this side of town. No one seemed to be able to get it right until now. I have been in all 4 restaurants over the years and saw the same thing every time, a dark, drab and dirty establishment with nothing more than bar food and a less than enthusiastic staff. Now walking in you will see a very modern and sleek decor with a nice size sushi bar and plenty of booths and table in the back.   The menu is quite extensive, with something for everyone. The quality was fresh, flavorful and not overly greasy. The portions were a good size and the presentation was, for a few of the entrees, a work of art.   Looks like the owners of Ming Fu got it right. Can't wait to go back and give the sushi a try.

Brdpcv03aurRg_0HTaodkw.text: I Went there for dinner with my two co-workers. The size of sushi roll is giant! Sashimi plates were awesome and fresh enough. Our waitress was just ok.. not great. We were three members, but she was keep bringing two chopsticks, two sake glasses, etc. I will come back for lunch. I recommend here to people who are craving for sushi. So much better than other sushi places in Matthews

BvQvy-7oiOay0gFMgILLkw.text: I went there for lunch one day and had the Sesame Chicken with white rice. For the price it is given, this entree is not worth it. Seriously, you're better off getting takeout from a cheap Chinese restaurant. However, the setting and ambience are excellent and that is why I am giving this restaurant a merciful 3 out of 5.

d8xM_KD1OnrGLB3BYZyjtA.text: We came here for lunch on a weekday, so it wasn't very busy. I would give 4 stars for the food/variety, but the service was pretty bad. I didn't catch the name of our server, but she was a young lady with glasses.   I liked that my daughter could get pretty good sushi, while I could get pretty good Chinese food at the same place. The restaurant is very well decorated and has a nice open feel to it. The sushi choices were somewhat limited, but the rolls were fresh and tasted good. The phoenix/dragon combo I had was very tasty also.   I was disappointed that I had to ask for chopsticks, then a to-go container, THEN the bill. After all of that, I left a 20% tip and the waitress just threw the remainder onto the table without a word and walked off. I immediately regretted leaving any tip at all.  In all fairness, she might have overheard my young(ish) daughter mention how rude the waitress seemed.  Out of the mouthes of babes...

dHA3U_lGiu6kArK-3W-giA.text: Great food.  But... Open until 10 == open til 10.  Not take out only and we are mopping around you and making you feel like like and intrusion at 940. WTF?

To-s_TvR3E8-Wf_-i3bwnw.text: Fairly typical Chinese food with a Sushi menu and nice restaurant seating area.  I wasn't as wow'd as I was hoping after reading all the rave reviews here on Yelp, but it is a pretty decent offering.  I tried the egg drop soup, which was a good value, the pork dumplings, which were meh - I think the sauce was overly sweet, the kung pao chicken, which was pretty good, and the chicken lo mein noodles, which were meh (but aren't all lo mein noodles pretty meh?).  Overall I would come back and get some take out because it does lie somewhere in between your PFChangs and your strip mall cheap Chinese take out place.  However, I don't believe it's that great of a value offering.  The prices are a bit high for cheap Chinese, and the quality is only just a bit higher.  Doesn't feel like you're getting a great deal.

3QtmleJ0BhNXxgCubocmUA.text: Server was great. I got a chicken veggie steamer and the chicken was not cooked all the way. It was a very deep pink in the center. I sent the meal back halfway through and the server went to talk to the owner. Not only did I not receive a replacement meal, but the owner only gave me 15% off of a meal that I was only able to eat half of. The owner/manager didn't even come to our table to address it or apologize. Not the way to run a restaurant...

t0k6jBg2nGbn3HfwSJ9Vpw.text: This is a new restaurant that opened in Matthews. We just moved from Atlanta and love sushi so wanted to check it out. We ordered sushi for take out, seaweed salad, miso soup. The decor is pretty. It's very understated and modern looking. None of the kitchsy Japanese dolls that grace a lot of Japanese restaurants. It would be nice if the interior had a little more color. There were a lot of grays, whites and browns, but that's a minor complaint.  I wanted to like the sushi, but, I didn't think there was anything that special about it. I got a few different types of rolls. The sushi rolls were not cheap so I had high hopes for them, but they seemed only a step above what you might buy in a grocery store sushi case. The rolls were a little bland tasting and the ingredients didn't seem so fresh. I can't speak about the regular menu. I may try this place once more, but if the regular dinners are also uninspired, I may have to go further into town for my sushi fix.

WVlGE4mTHuRNKoX69UGGaQ.text: Amazing sushi and I loved their fried noodles and duck sauce !!! Their home made duck sauce was amazing! Ask for Maggie as your waitress. She was amazing!
